page.title: 14Tourism
page.content: There is a small attractive camping site at Cherry tree farm, with pitches for 25 tents beside the river. Charges are #3 per night and the site is open between April and October. Facilities provided are limited, i.e. toilets and cold water only; however the majority of the visitors here prefer a simple site. Holiday makers come from this country and abroad; during the day they tour the countryside or go to the beach, returning in the evenings to the peace of the site. Planning regulations stipulate only tents on this site, but the Caravan Act on 1960 does permit touring vans for overnight stops. Caravans however are rarely seen at the site. The type of tents on site range from small hiking tents used by walkers and cyclists to the large modern bungalow tents, used by families.
